name: wardrobe_commit_organizer
summary: Organize uncommitted changes into atomic, focused commits following commit hygiene guidelines.
description: Analyzes git working directory and stages changes into logical, atomic commits. Uses Qwen for semantic grouping and Gemma for fast classification. Prevents generic commit messages across repository folders.
steps: Analyze git status to identify all uncommitted changes
Use Gemma to classify changes: code, docs, config, tests
Use Qwen to semantically group related files (e.g., component + test + story)
Separate by scope: module-specific changes (gotjunk, wsp_orchestrator, etc.)
Isolate documentation commits (ModLog.md, README.md) from code commits
Generate focused commit messages per group using conventional commit format
Execute atomic commits: git add [files] && git commit -m 'type(scope): description'
Validate: No single commit touches multiple unrelated modules

qwen.usage: Determine which files are logically related for same commit

commit_hygiene_rules.focused_scope: Type(scope) only touches that scope's files
commit_hygiene_rules.separate_docs: Documentation commits separate from code commits
commit_hygiene_rules.descriptive: Describe THIS commit, not the whole feature

inputs.enforce_scope_isolation: Reject commits touching multiple modules (default: true)

outputs.ungrouped_files: Files that couldn't be grouped logically
outputs.details: Description of actions taken or why blocked

integration.git_push_dae: Call this skill BEFORE making push decision to organize commits
